intro: Psilocarphus brevissimus var. brevissimus, commonly known as the short-stemmed psilocarphus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, compact growth habit and distinctive, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
